abstract: The resizing mode of the image.
overview:
## Discussion

The default value for this property is [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIImage/ResizingMode-swift.enum/tile]. However, [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIImage] will implement the resizing mode the fastest way possible while still retaining the desired visual appearance. This means that if the region to be resized is a 1-pixel region and this property is set to [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIImage/ResizingMode-swift.enum/tile], the region will be stretched instead because the two are virtually indistinguishable for a region of that size and stretching is dramatically faster than tiling. To set the value of this property, you need to call either [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIImage/animatedResizableImageNamed(_:capInsets:resizingMode:duration:)] or [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIImage/resizableImage(withCapInsets:resizingMode:)] and specify the resizing mode using the `resizingMode` parameter. For a list of possible values for this property, see [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIImage/ResizingMode-swift.enum].

# resizingMode

**Instance Property**

The resizing mode of the image.

## Declaration

```swift
var resizingMode: UIImage.ResizingMode { get }
```

## Discussion

The default value for this property is [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIImage/ResizingMode-swift.enum/tile]. However, [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIImage] will implement the resizing mode the fastest way possible while still retaining the desired visual appearance. This means that if the region to be resized is a 1-pixel region and this property is set to [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIImage/ResizingMode-swift.enum/tile], the region will be stretched instead because the two are virtually indistinguishable for a region of that size and stretching is dramatically faster than tiling. To set the value of this property, you need to call either [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIImage/animatedResizableImageNamed(_:capInsets:resizingMode:duration:)] or [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIImage/resizableImage(withCapInsets:resizingMode:)] and specify the resizing mode using the `resizingMode` parameter. For a list of possible values for this property, see [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIImage/ResizingMode-swift.enum].

## Accessing image attributes

- **imageOrientation**: The orientation of the receiver’s image.
- **UIImage.Orientation**: Constants that specify the intended display orientation for an image.
- **flipsForRightToLeftLayoutDirection**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the image flips in a right-to-left layout.
- **UIImage.ResizingMode**: Constants that specify the possible resizing modes for an image.
- **duration**: The time interval for displaying an animated image.
- **capInsets**: The end-cap insets.
- **alignmentRectInsets**: The alignment metadata for positioning the image during layout.
- **isSymbolImage**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the image is a symbol.
